review.title: nice manager
review.reviewText: room is clean , space, comforable, the lobby manager is a nice guy, will come again, the breakfast is fresh, coffee is better taste than Mcd**, similar to Star**,  recommend to everyone
review.positiveRemarks: room is clean , space, comforable, the lobby manager is a nice guy, the breakfast is fresh, coffee is better taste than Mcd**, similar to Starb**
review.locationRemarks: restaurants , closed to SFO

review.title: Close to airport, reasonable cost.
review.reviewText: Checked in late so just slept and left but everything was fine, clean and comfy.

This hotel was great value for money. It was close to the airport, and the staff were great. I didn't book the airport shuttle ahead of time, but when I asked the staff to call a cab, they called the shuttle at the last minute for me. The room was large, with everything I could want.

review.title: Good hotel pity about the television
review.reviewText: The hotel was good and the manager was very helpful explaining how we could get into San Francisco by public transport even offering to sort out the correct change for us in the morning, Pity he was not on duty.  The breakfast was excellent but there was not enough space for all the guests who required breakfast, which although good was repetitive. On the third night the television in our room would not work and the young man on duty tried to rectify the fault with the signal,  He told us that the whole hotel was affected but. when asked why the TV in the foyer was still broadcasting he decided that the signal to each floor was separate so only our floor was affected.  In the morning the manager said it was a problem with the weather and their signal. A very individualised weather effect,
review.positiveRemarks: It was spotlessly clean and we were pleased to see two chairs in the room
review.negativeRemarks: Quality of TV signal.  It is good to relax after a day out around San Francisco.

review.title: Close to airport + Caltrain Station, best manager.
review.reviewText: First rate stay close to the airport and walking distance to Caltrain. Manager Victor and his team look after you really well, complimentary breakfast was appreciated. No request was too much. Excellent.
review.positiveRemarks:
Helpful staff.
Breakfast.
Comfortable.
review.locationRemarks:
Caltrain.
Airport.

review.title: Hotel close to SFO
review.reviewText: This Ramada is close to the San Francisco airport, which is why I booked it.  I was disappointed in it for several reasons:  (1) although my room was said to be nonsmoking there was a heavy odor of smoke in it; (2) I could not get hot water at the sink; (3) on the one computer available for use I could not find a USB port and therefore couldn't print out a document I needed; and (4) there was no hot water available at breakfast with which to make tea.
review.positiveRemarks: The reasonable price and the desk staff.

review.reviewText: It's convenient and close to San Francisco International airport. After stuck in the SF downtown traffic jam for 2-3 hours, we felt living in a hotel near by the airport is a must, for next morning flight.
review.locationRemarks: Nearby the hotel, there is nice area with many restaurants including some Chinese restaurants.

review.title: Condition
review.reviewText: The facilities are poorly maintained and the room smelled as if someone was constantly smoking inside of it.
We had a short stay, but it was very comfortable and staff was very friendly! We will stay again next time we go to San Francisco.

review.title: Pretty nice
review.reviewText:
The room was visually appealing and clean. The temperature was easy to control,  but I didn't like that the window could only be opened several inches.
We found the beds to be hard, but the TV was decent. Breakfast was satisfactory,  but the smell of pot in the elevator and hallway was annoying.
Competitively priced 2 star hotel in location convenient to SFO, courteous staff, well maintained.
It was not bad for a one night visit. The location was good and easy to get to.
Very nice, clean hotel. Maybe a little discount esp those who are only staying overnight but overall, we like staying here.
review.positiveRemarks: friendly staff, cleanliness

review.title: horrible, questionable safety/ secure location !!!
review.reviewText:
this should NOT be a Ramada !!! horrible , unsafe location.
we were afraid to leave our car in the parking lot ! "close to the airport "....
it was also "close to the CHOP SHOP " in the rear of the building !!!
we did not leave our room once we checked in , too uncomfortable
with the area !  Room and hallways smelled of old fashioned chemicals used to 
remove smoke smell from hotels !
   RAMADA should pay a surprise visit to this site . We have stayed in many Ramada locations.
THIS ONE SHOULD NOT FLY THE RAMADA FLAG !
review.positiveRemarks: NOTHING
review.negativeRemarks: MOVE  IT OUT OF THE GHETTO
review.locationRemarks: CLOSE TO AIRPORT

review.title: Ghetto hotel
review.reviewText: Cold breakfast,run down hotel,very smoky smell of old cigarette. Very small area for breakfast, mold in bathroom
1 of the amenities listed is they have laundry but they don't have one.Staff are not as helpful and friendly.

review.title: Great hospitality.
review.reviewText:
Staff helped me about my trouble.
He found a solution with Internet.
Great!

review.title: very nice hotel
review.reviewText: the front desk receptor is very friendly and professional, clean room and convenient parking, we love it very much

review.title: Do not go here
review.reviewText:
The room had ants all over the counter and sink the first morning I woke up. The staff would not switch rooms for me or compensate me for the night even when I showed them pictures of the sink and counter area. 
The beds were rock hard and the pillows felt like shredded foam rubber.
There were no ammenties to speak of. The breakfast consisted of hard boiled eggs, greasy sausage and cold microwaved pancakes. There was one choices of Orange juice that was watery at times.

Extremely noisy, not from the airport, but from inconsiderate guests, slamming doors at 5AM. There is no excuse for such rudeness.
I do realize the hotel is in the process of renovating, but rooms still need to be cleaned, so that there isn't debris at the edges of the carpets.

review.title: Good for what it is
review.reviewText: Clean, spacious room, wifi enabled. Parking. Efficient. Friendly staff. Not my first preference, but price was right.
review.positiveRemarks: Accommodating two queen beds in a spacious room.
review.negativeRemarks: Dampen the noise from street (located adjacent to 101, so I don't think there is anything to be done about this). Dampen the noise from heater.

review.title: Smoking and hair
review.reviewText: I was booked a smoking room without my knowledge so the room reeked.  I went to get into bed and there were stray hairs all over the bed.  I called and requested a room change which they did, but would not move me from a smoking room as that is what Expedia booked me.  The next room still reeked and there appeared to be dried blood on the back of one of the pillows.  I chose to leave and sleep at the airport rather than try and sleep in a stinky, smoky room.

review.title: Front desk person was very rude. Room was dirty.
review.reviewText: Front desk person was very rude. Room was dirty. Do not count on the free breakfast , nothing was left and staff was blunt and did not refill . Overall a bad hotel

review.title: Nice hotel, safe place.
review.reviewText: Great hotel, safe and there are many shops close by. Breakfast is not that good and sometimes you can hear people from your room and also we were on a non-smoking floor and we could smell someone smoking on our floor for around 3 days. Come early if you want to find parking

review.title: Nice hotel
review.reviewText: Every thing was good but specially the person on front desk mr. Vector he was so co-operative and very nice person

review.title: Just for sleeping
review.reviewText: Clean, comfortable and close to airport and Freeway.

review.title: Friendly, easy acces and safe
review.reviewText: Staff is super friendly especially the gentleman that works the front desk. I was a female traveling alone and felt safe the whole time I stayed here. It's a great area for easy access to SF and south of using the freeway and public bus. I would say the cleaning in none visible areas needs to be more thorough. The rest was clean and room was big for a girl with 3 luggages and holiday shopping. Would stay here again for sure.
For the money, can't beat this hotel for location, safety and the kind staff.
review.positiveRemarks: Cost, location and warm welcome!
review.negativeRemarks: Little maintenance and soft closing doors.
review.locationRemarks: Close to Grand Avenue for eateries and coffee shops.

review.reviewText: The staff was friendly and the rooms were beautiful, I enjoyed the view from the room as well, breakfast was pleasant.
convenient location, decent price (74), easy check in, clean room, friendly staff

review.title: Great value close to san francisco airport
review.reviewText: Staff at front desk obliging, efficient and friendly. Got me in my comfortable clean room quickly. Shuttle was on time (5am) Reasonably priced too.

review.title: Lowest Common Denominator
review.reviewText: Arrived at midnight, no parking in front of front office, so you have to park in the basement and walk up the car ramp. Checked into room and it was immediately apparent that the light switch for the room lights didn't work. Front desk manager tried switching lightbulbs, which I thought was not likely to fix problem and it didn't. He didn't have another room for me, but said he'd have it fixed the next day. When I returned the next day, it was exactly the same.
review.positiveRemarks: Close to airport
review.locationRemarks: Nothing of interest nearby.

review.title: Nice stay
review.reviewText: The manager was so friendly and made u feel at home

review.title: Safe parking,  staff very friendly,  large room
review.reviewText: Not the best area but for the money it was more than adequate.  Breakfast area was small but clean, breakfast items were limited but again, adequate.
review.positiveRemarks: The price was great for San Francisco and the freeway was handy for getting to points of interest.
review.negativeRemarks: Newer towels and sheets...use some bleach to whiten the towels.
review.locationRemarks: Near the freeway to reach all points of interest.  Did see public transportation nearby but we drove our own car.  Felt it was a safe place to park.

review.title: Stay away from this hotel
review.reviewText: The location is close to airport which is excellent. But it is just beside a very heavy traffic road, very loud noise all the days and night. You would be waked up at 2:00am definitely, you can't change a room as it is "full" as being told. Breakfast offerred just a few selections and terrible. The Internet WiFi signal is very weak, did not work at all, but you could find signal of Lows store across the road.

review.title: it was a nice hotel for price I will stay again
review.reviewText: was not in hotel much but was a very nice room the staff was very friendly and helpful
review.positiveRemarks: the room was big clean and had nice tv
review.negativeRemarks: better breakfast
review.locationRemarks: I was here for business

review.title: Great location by the airport
review.reviewText: The hotel is very conveniently located to SFO.  The staff was super friendly and allowed me to check-in early since I landed at noon.  He even upgraded me to a King room since it was available.  The room was large, clean and bright and suited my needs perfectly.
review.positiveRemarks: Very convenient, easy freeway access, minutes from the city and very safe location.
review.negativeRemarks: The room was somewhat dated and could be freshened up with some artwork and new desk chair.
review.locationRemarks: Safe, convenient, easy freeway access.

review.title: Nice affordable hotel close to  S.F.
review.reviewText: If you don't mind driving a little or taking public transportation to Downtown San Francisco, this hotel is an affordable option.  The hotel manager is very friendly.  The rooms are large and clean.  Parking is free.
review.positiveRemarks: Affordability.  Clean and roomy.  Beds were comfortable.
review.negativeRemarks: Shower control unit could be better.  It was tricky to set it to warm because it was sensitive if you turned the knob a little in the wrong direction.
review.locationRemarks: Some nice shops within walking distance.  Gas station nearby.  Tanforan shopping center not too far.  There is also a Costco nearby.

review.reviewText: It worked for our travel needs. At least it was clean

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: Courteous staff the continental breakfast is okay and the location is lack public transportation and there is no restaurant near by and I wish easy access to public transportation and restaurant and overall it's okay
Front desk staff extremely helpful  and great customer serviceüëç

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: I booked the hotel with the book now pay at the hotel when we got there....I thought u wouldn't pay till check out like we have done at most hotels...my husband went down the next morning to do the check out n they had already done the check out n charged the card that I had held the room with...in which was not the card we were going to use to pay with....so it over drew that account....so I was not happy about that he did refund on the one card n actually charged the card that we actually wanted to pay with......I have yet to c the refund hoping to c it n a day or 2....but I thought that was kinda rude that no one paid attention to how I booked the room n just took it upon themselves to check us out 2 hours early n charge the card.....

review.title: Good for stay before early departure
review.reviewText: Upon check-in, the person at the desk was very friendly and helpful.  He told me exactly what we could do to return our rental that night (highly recommend) and catch their shuttle back to the hotel, which enabled us to take their shuttle to the airport for a very early flight. This also allowed us to save money on hotel parking. The room was nice and clean, but furnishings were a bit old.  Price was fair, I guess, although everything around SFO seems expensive to me.  We missed breakfast because we had such an early flight.
review.positiveRemarks: Helpful staff, free airport shuttle, close to airport.
review.locationRemarks: This hotel is located on a busy street, we did not see any place to eat nearby.

review.title: Very good hotel, uninteresting surroundings
review.reviewText:
Booked here 2 nights as we were driving up from the south and wanted someway to stay out of SF. From here we drove into SF and around bay area for the usual tourist things. Area around hotel pretty dull but there are restaurants just down the road (can walk if its not too hot). The hotel manager (a South African) was very friendly and helpful, and the hotel was of good quality.
Found navigating the roads and freeways in the area quite challenging. Was pleased to have my GPS - (which I managed to break while returning from SF to the hotel. Had to get an emergency new one from a local Target.)
review.positiveRemarks: Very helpful manager.
review.locationRemarks: Restaurants in South SF (and of course there's the airport).

review.title: Stay away!
review.reviewText: Our stay here was the worst experience I have ever had! The sheets were clearly dirty and stained, the AC did not work, the floor was dirty and seemed like it had not been vacuumed in weeks! I was too disgusted to sleep on the sheets or touch anything. Terrible accommodations for the price! Please pay the extra few bucks to stay anywhere else...
review.positiveRemarks: NOTHING
review.negativeRemarks: EVERYTHING!!! Especially the cleanliness!!!
review.locationRemarks: Away from the heart of San Francisco, close to the airport. There is nothing to do nearby.

review.title: Horrible breakfast
review.reviewText: Little noisy. Good for 1 night. Good price. Clean room.
Nice nothing too fancy but accomodating and Comfy!

review.title: The front desk staff had not personality and very
review.reviewText: Room was nice but bed was a little hard. Low water pressure at bathroom sink. Nice breakfast. Had cold foods out long before posted times. Great for international travelers on a different schedule
review.positiveRemarks: see above
review.negativeRemarks: see above
review.locationRemarks: not much to do nearby

review.title: Richie review
review.reviewText:
In general was OK, but one day at breakfast time, the bagges were in no good condition (green color like expired)
my wife and me didn't  eat there that and the nex day either.
we stayed two days
was told upon checkin could not give award account number to accrue points because we booked on Expedia

review.title: Convenient hotel to airport
review.reviewText:
Convenient location. Free shuttle to airport and back.  Nice continental breakfast.
Staff was outstanding!!!  Stayed one night only  Reasonable price (for SF).
Signfiicant freeway noise.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, staff, staff.!!!  Room nice clean and functional.
review.locationRemarks: Close to reasonable restaurants and fast food within walking distance. (5-6 blks)

review.title: Nice hotel close to the airport.
review.reviewText: Had a great experience at the Ramada limited.  We stayed 4 days on a get away for our kids spring break.  The location was conveniently located close to the Bart so we were able to ride the Bart into Fishermens wharf and save on parking.  It was also close to the mall & Target.  My son got an ear infection while on vacation and was lucky enough to find a Kaiser ER only 10 minutes away.  The house keeper was awesome and knew we had kids with us so she made animals with the towels for them.  The manager of the hotel was friendly and helpful.  Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an inexpensive place to stay while visiting San Francisco
Lots of free stuff such as parking, breakfast, internet ... The location is good as well.

review.title: the price was right and easy to get to
review.reviewText: they were doing remodel. I was told at check in that they would be done at 630pm but they were still working at 900pm. they were working in the hall right next to our room and dust everywhere. the rooms smelled bad of dust and paint. they could have moved us to another floor but check us into the room right next to where to work was being done. work men had to move buckets out of the way every time we needed to walk past. bathrooms smelled of mold although they looked clean.
review.positiveRemarks: the front desk man was very nice and check in was fast and convenient. there was also plenty of parking
review.negativeRemarks: they should not fill the rooms next to men working. made a very bad experience
review.locationRemarks: food was close and hotel right off the freeway

review.title: Not Understanding
review.reviewText: Unfortunately my flight was cancelled and I had to be re-booked the day I was supposed to travel. I notified the hotel immediately and they declined giving me a refund or even a partial one. I was very disappointed because this situation was completely out of my control and at no fault of my own. I would expect a hotel that has bookings daily to be more understanding. That being said, Expedia was very helpful and although they couldn't assist me with a cash refund they did give me a credit on my Expedia account to use towards future purchases. I will not book at a Ramada again, but I will use Expedia for sure!
review.positiveRemarks: n/a
review.negativeRemarks: Better refund policy.
review.locationRemarks: n/a

review.title: Poor housekeeping
review.reviewText:
Only one handtowel and one wash cloth in the room for 3 people to share? 
There were debris all over the hallway carpet. Filthy. I mentioned it to the front desk person and he said it was due to construction. Even so, they need to hire more housekeeping staff to keep up w the property.  Or else train existing staff. Both front desk staff disappeared twice. That meant anyone could walk in and roam the halls. Breakfast was ok. Website said there'd be hard boiled eggs. None. Pancakes and sausage were ok.

review.title: Everything was pretty good thanks so much .
review.reviewText: I am happy with the atenchion and everything was clean and ready for my husband and I  thanks a lot.

review.title: Employees
review.reviewText:
We stayed just one night en route between Seattle and Sacramento.   I was a little concerned that the shuttle might not be prompt but the service , picking up and dropping off was excellent.
The two employees on the desk when we checked in and out, that is Davis and Frank, could not have been more friendly and helpful.
We were very pleased,
review.positiveRemarks: Very reasonable cost.  Good proximity to the airport. Helpful employees.  Friendly.  Shuttle worked well for us.
review.locationRemarks: We only stopped there because we had a short night to spend between flights.

review.title: convenient to SFSU
review.reviewText: Not for getaway. Good convenient area for a weekend to get things done.
review.positiveRemarks: convenient with free wifi and parking was a plus
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast, particularly coffee
review.locationRemarks: walking distance to restaurants, etc

review.title: not happy
review.reviewText: not good for light sleepers due to road/fwy noise. tub doesn't drain properly. staff not attentive-makes you wait, lacks friendliness. booked a smoking room by mistake-smell was horrible. offer to switch to non smoking would have been nice but mgr didn't care. not enough parking space at night. we're asked to park in the street where it says "no parking 3am-5am". stains on towels and bed linens. sorry but I'm not coming back.

review.title: Very nice
review.reviewText: Great, clean, and cheap for other hotels prices equivalent

review.title: Clean well run hotel right at the airport.
review.reviewText: Very friendly and clean hotel 7 minutes from the SFO INT airpprt.
review.positiveRemarks: Convinient airport location  with clean rooms and friendly staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Increase space for eating breakfast.

review.reviewText: A nice hotel close to the freeway, easy access to the airport and San Francisco.   Basically clean, few stains here and there, no difference than any other hotels in the same price range.  The staff working at the desk were very helpful and polite.  The complementary continental breakfast was the standard fare of cereals, breads, fruits but also included sausage, pancakes, and French toast.   Highly recommend going in early because the hot foods run out quickly.  Overall I would definatly come back.

review.title: Not as nice as the pictures, but still a good stay
review.reviewText: I was a bit disappointed about the state of the hotel. It seemed nicer in the pictures. It wasn't horrible, just older and a bit more worn than I thought. It was very clean, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was decent, and there was a pretty good variety (pancakes, boiled eggs, sausage, oatmeal, cereal, fruit, etcetera). We saw a few bugs in the room, but it was some type of beetle, and not roaches or bedbugs. The front desk was very helpful. We had a noise issue from an indeterminate room one night, and they resolved it quickly, even though it required them to actually walk the building to find it.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was extremely nice and responsive. The hotel was clean.
review.negativeRemarks: It needs some updating. Replacing the carpet and couches would be a great start.
review.locationRemarks: Very convenient to food and freeway. Close enough to San Francisco's attractions that the drive isn't bad.

review.reviewText: Nice free breakfast and good location to stay very close to the airport and tourist spots.

review.title: Quiet hotel close to the airport
review.reviewText: Room was fine with good A/C and clear view of the road and freeway. Comfortable stay
review.positiveRemarks: Neat, clean and spacious room. Decent staff and breakfast area.
review.locationRemarks: Not much of facilities available nearby

review.title: Nice hotel.
review.reviewText: It was a nice experience.It was a comfortable stay.

review.title: Would stay again :-)
review.reviewText: We stayed our first night in San Francisco, went to Calistoga and stayedagain on our last night. The first room had a stain on the loveseat/couch and some chipped paint. The second room was good. The beds and pillows werent high quality but were comfortable. We enjoyed the many breakfast options.  Victor and the desk staff were very kind and welcomed my children. Would recommend the hotel to others.

review.title: Convenient location to airport and downtown
review.reviewText: Staff was very nice. Room was cozy and comfy. Toilet was not working but maintenance took care of it in less than 20 minutes. Lots of tv channels to choose from (dish network).   Location is perfectly near downtown and airport. Free parking was nice to have. Wifi is good besides the fact you have to sign in every 12 hours. Breakfast was not too great or bad. Not too much to choose from. Overall the stay was amazing. I would come here again

review.title: Pricey for what you get
review.reviewText: I got a nonsmoking room an a smoking floor. The room was not smokey but the hallway was aweful. The room was clean but dated and looked like scratched used furniture. The staff was helpful but couldn't solve the lack of tv stations available. Dog barking for hours!
it was nice and close to where we wanted to go.

review.title: Dirty and wrinkled linens
review.reviewText: Upon check in the room , the pillow cases were dirty and wrinkled , the bed spread was all wrinkled. Seems like it wasn't changed.

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was courteous and friendly.  They give good advice on where to go or give good directions.  They also recommended good places to eat.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked the fact that the parking is free and has plenty of parking and breakfast was good. The room was very nice and clean.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel is located near HWY 101, SSF Caltrain station is on other side of hwy 101 across from hotel.  Easy to navigate by car or Caltrain/Bart to SF

review.title: Nice hotel for an overnighter near the SFO
review.reviewText: It was okay.  It's good for only staying for an over nighter in the area.
The hotel was everything I could ask for in a relatively cheap hotel. For the most part the room was up to date and it was very clean. The hotel staff was friendly. Overall no complaints.

review.title: Great value
review.reviewText: A nice clean hotel room for a reasonable price. And the hotel shuttle was really helpful, too!

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: The hotel was acceptable kind of thought it was noisy because of the freeway

review.title: Not Bad
review.reviewText: I stayed at this Ramada for 2 night and overall it was a pleasant enough experience. The hotel is close to the airport and offers free parking. It also has in room wifi, a mini fridge and a microwave. The continental breakfast on Sunday was rather sparse but Mondays offering was a vast improvement. The staff was courteous and helpful and responded quickly to several request on my part. I would definitely stay there again.

review.title: Close to airport
review.reviewText: No sound barrier, you can hear everything. Comforters looked bad.

review.title: Nice!
review.reviewText: Staff was very friendly and helpful. I would stay again.

review.title: 5 Day Vacation to San Francisco
review.reviewText:
First we would like to say that Victor was a very friendly and professional manager who dealt with issues very quickly. I was disappointed with another front desk clerk who was fast asleep one evening when we came back to the hotel and guests were waiting for assistance.

The hotel room had a smell but we left the window open during our five day stay and it helped. The room was away from the highway and was quiet and the beds were very comfortable so we did sleep well. The furniture is worn as is the carpet and is in need of updating. For the price of the hotel room we thought it was disappointing but I realize that the prices in San Francisco are very high which is why we stayed at the airport location. It is convenient to the city - a 15 minute drive. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as it was very limiting. We read all the reviews prior to our trip so we knew what they were and I have to agree with the comments which were made.
review.positiveRemarks: The friendly assistance from Victor and the comfortable beds.
review.negativeRemarks: Upgrading of the carpet, the furniture and the drapes.
review.locationRemarks: Airport close by, shopping mall, restaurants, movie theatres, access to the highway to San Fran or to head out of town to Carmel or San Jose.

review.title: Didn't expect much and got less
review.reviewText: Wouldn't want to stay at this hotel again. I tried to change my reservation from 2 king smoking rooms to non smoking over the phone mins after booking them and was told it was impossible without a $70 charge. When I got to the hotel I was told the only rooms available were a king smoking and a double non smoking and if I didn't take them I would still get charged. Strange how I can't make changes prior but they can and don't give any other option. The rooms were noisy, I could hear the planes and cars outside with the windows closed. I also hear every single door outside my room open and close everytime someone went in and out. The sheets were stained, room stunk like cigarets, the sofa was ripped, tv didn't work and when asked to get it fixed I was told it would be by the time I returned, 4 hrs later it still didn't work. The rooms started getting really cold because at night but the windows were closed so I turned on the heater and it didn't really work. Overall not a good experience.

review.title: Safe, clean, got a good rate for 5 nights stay..
review.reviewText: Travelled to San Fran with my daughter to visit a love one. Hotel is conveniently located from the airport and places we visited.. nice clean room, service is good, friendly staff, will surely stay again in this hotel.

review.title: Will stay here again!
review.reviewText: We stayed here for two nights. Walking into the lobby, I was pleasantly surprised with this place after seeing mediocre ratings here. The hotel is clean and smells good. You can tell it's well taken care of. All the fixtures are pretty updated. It almost felt like a holiday inn. The rooms were good too and the staff was pretty well spoken as well. It's about 5 mins from the airport and about 15 mins from downtown. Usually continental breakfast means cold boring options but they had a decent spread here. You can make your own hot waffles.. Boiled eggs..fruits .. Cereal bars .. Etc. definitely happy with our stay.

review.title: Ideal Location
review.reviewText: We had a early AM flight overseas this Location was IDEAL for quick access to the Airport! We arrived at the terminal with in 5 minutes from leaving our Ramada Location. We use this location when ever we fly out of San Francisco it saves us a FOUR (4) Hour drive in the early morning from Sacramento. Clean and pleasant!
review.positiveRemarks: LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION to the AIRPORT
review.negativeRemarks: Eggs with my BREAKFAST............. :-)
review.locationRemarks: Nice dining restaurants within walking distance !

review.title: Good Experience
review.reviewText: The location was a bit out-of-the-way from the SFO Airport and any BART transportation, but the hotel did an excellent job providing a taxi-based shuttle service. Frank and Victor were attentive and polite hosts who did all that was asked of them in the way of assistance and advice.
review.positiveRemarks: Price, room was comfortable and quiet, continental breakfast was provided.
review.negativeRemarks: The orange juice could be better as served in the morning and they need a new toaster ASAP.
review.locationRemarks: Somewhat out of the way, but convenient to a CalTrain (South San Francisco) stop that was a 10-15 walk or <5 minutes walk to a bus stop to get to SF.

review.reviewText: A perfect airport hotel experience. Room was very comfortable, good check in/out, and easy acccess to SFO airport. I would go again.

review.title: sketchy staff
review.reviewText: the host was very welcoming and very informative. loved his personally. we stayed one night two days. we went to a movie around 7pm and my fiance left his wallet in the room, we had giftcards. The next day when we were leaving we couldn't find his wallet. We searched the room, moved mattresses (no spot under the bed because of the frame) and our suitcases and car. Asked cleaning ladies if they cleanned our room and their only response was "yes towels, more towels." Very large communication barrier. No luck, left our contact info with the host and left at 1130. At 230 they called saying they found our wallet under the bed. There is no space there and $30 went missing. Will not stay there again.

review.title: It's OK for us
review.reviewText: Actually, it's better than my expected for room condition. It's a little noisy because of the location, but it's not bad. The only problem for us is the shuttle schedule. We have checked for the shuttle schedule before booking, but we were told there was not shuttle at 4 am because of New Year. Although it's reasonable, but it's hard to say to be satisfied. Otherwise, I'll set 5 stars.

review.title: Great hotel
review.reviewText: Very nice hotel great service and room. The free breakfast was awesome a lot of selections. The general manager Victor was so kind and helpful i will definitely be back.

review.title: Good just for a short stay!
review.reviewText:
Although the hotel was located in a accessible area, close to a big Mall and the room was very spacious and clean, there were many negative points about it that helped my rating decision! There was only one staff in the reception, who was always there, morning and evenings and seemed to be always ready to help, was polite and very pleasant.
The breakfast room and facilities were not good. First of all, there was no breakfast room, it was at the reception, just in front of it! The hotel door, at the reception was always open, therefore, if you are having bkf, it was always cold and unpleasant. All breakfast cutlery and plates/cups were made of plastic. The orange juice tasted like water, although it was supposed to be from "Minute Maid", 100% juice, but tasted nothing like water. The apple juice was also very bad. Very poor selection of bread/ no butter and whatever it was, it didnt also taste good!
I booked a disabled accessible room with a roll in shower but it had no rooms at all like that, so, theoretically, I couldn't have a shower or a bath.
review.positiveRemarks: The size of the room, which was quite spacious. WiFi available
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast facilities / Rooms for disabled people with a roll in shower.
review.locationRemarks: Not bad located (if you have a car). Big Mall nearby and some other shops.

review.title: Ok for the price
review.reviewText:
Room was clean amenities were better and bigger than expected. The smell of the room could have
Could have been better. Overall a good stay.

review.positiveRemarks: It's good place,near the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast.

review.title: Out of date despite good ratings
review.reviewText: Despite good ratings, hotel lives up to it's name 'Limited', and seems very old, outdated. Very basic.
No vending machines with snacks one drink machine no place in waking distance to get food. Room was fine breakfast terrible

review.title: Airport Layover
review.positiveRemarks: Close to airport. Well-reviewed. Free transportation to airport. Great price for value..
review.negativeRemarks: The overhead bathroom light in Room 417, I believe that's the room #, was not working.

review.title: Standard room = smoking!
review.reviewText: I requested a standard room and ended up getting a smoking room. Double check the fine prints when you book on Expedia!
review.positiveRemarks: clean room. free taxis from the airport.
review.negativeRemarks: continental breakfast was very minimal. The waffle machine broke down and we had a choice of milk, cereal, jam, toast and coffee.

review.title: Very dissapointed
review.reviewText: Hotel staff was very friendly and quick to get us in our room. But upon entering the room we easily noticed there was an odd odor which was enough to turn us away. There was no way that we would be able to sleep in the room with that gross smell lingering. Also the bathroom had smelled so strongly of bleach that it was unbearable to be in there for more than a couple of seconds. So we immediately went back down to the front desk and asked for another room complaining about the issues and were out of luck because it was all sold out for the night(amazingly). We then asked for some kind of deodorizing spray to use in the room and bathroom, which too our surprise worked pretty well in covering up the smell in the rooms after about an hour. Will never stay here again and would never recommend this place to a friend.

review.title: Decent hotel for a short stay
review.reviewText: Victor, the GM of the hotel was really friendly. He made sure everything was ok for us the moment we checked in. It's a decent hotel for a short stay and is closer to the airport. The breakfast menu can definitely improve though. Rooms are clean and the bath room is in good condition too.

review.title: Average hotel.
review.reviewText: Small hotel locates nearby Hway 101 and SF Airport. Clean room for short term stay. Cheap breakfast.

review.title: nice close to the airport
review.reviewText:
however not easily accessible on airport blvd
breakfast should be improved
review.positiveRemarks: Rooms were clean
review.negativeRemarks: breakfast wifi
review.locationRemarks: Fishermans Wharf Lowe's store Union Square Costco store

review.title: everything was good
review.reviewText: Very good experience. excellent staff,clean and organized hotel.better than last year in October,2012 that I was there.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked it.
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing in particular.
review.locationRemarks: Easy to find and close to highway.

review.title: Attitude of front desk, Frank, was real bad!!
review.reviewText: We requested to have 2 beds when we booked the room. However, the clerk, Frank, told us that all they can provide was a king size and if we have any question, we need to call Expedia. I asked him whether that was because all the 2-bed were occupied. He said no but that was what he can give us. He doesn't care what we arranged with Expedia, all they can provide is a king size. I requested yo talk to his manager and he said there was no manager. So I asked him for his name and he turned to me and said "so is there a problem!?"......this is kind of the service that I received!

review.title: Disappointed in condition of hotel
review.reviewText: There were holes in the comforter as well as the foldout sleeper sofa upholstery. There were only 2 towels and washcloths for the 3 of us in the room. When I called the desk to request more towels around 8:30 PM, I was told it would be at least 30 minutes before more were available. I was advised to wait until after 8:30 the next morning because housekeeping staff did not come in until 8:00. When we returned to the room the following evening, there were only 2 clean towels and washcloths left when the room was cleaned. Also, the lobby was torn apart by workers performing renovations, and it was difficult to get to and from the elevator, especially with luggage. We were definitely disappointed and did not feel the room was worth $200.00 a night!
review.positiveRemarks: The hotel is near the airport and the freeway to reach downtown San Francisco.

review.title: Victor the concierge!
review.reviewText: Great experience! Me and two girlfriends were in town for the Justin Timberlake concert last weekend and this hotel was an affordable place that was pretty close by to everything we needed. Super easy just to take the 292 bus downtown to go shopping (30 mins away maybe?) but definitely better than taking our car & navigating traffic in the city which would definitely take longer. The concierge, Victor, was like our new best friend!! He was super nice and always there to help us out. Especially since we are three 20 year old girls, he made sure we felt safe and told us which parts of town to avoid and whether it would be better to drive to a place or take a taxi, etc. He was always looking out for us and our best interest. The hotel was easy to find when we drove into town, and is on Airport Blvd if you're flying it's super close too. We didn't really need much since we were out and about all weekend, so we basically just crashed at the hotel from our adventures in the city all day. But the rooms were good for the price, and the continental breakfast wasn't great but we went to get coffee and bagels when we were in the city anyway so it didn't matter.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean facilities, close to airport, friendly and helpful staff, and bus station nearby to take you to downtown San Fran.

review.title: Close to hotel & easy access to highway.
review.reviewText: The general manager greeted us & was very welcoming. We had never been to San Francisco & he was full of information.
review.positiveRemarks: I loved how convenient it was for everything.
review.locationRemarks: The hotel had easy access to the highway.

review.title: Affordable hotel 12 mi from San Francisco center
review.reviewText: Reasonably priced and only 12 mi from San Francisco. Situated next to freeway. Even during peak hours didn't take more than 15-20 min to the city center.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, free parking, near highway

review.title: Good location - Helpful staff
review.reviewText:
Great place to stay a few days if you are just looking for a basic hotel.
Staff was friendly and helpful, would definitely book again at the right price.
review.positiveRemarks: Location, Helpful staff, Parking, Late night room service (from offsite restaurant).
review.negativeRemarks: Could use updating, new room furniture, carpet, bedding etc. Lobby is too small to accommodate more than a few people for Continental breakfast.

review.title: Old and outdated
review.reviewText: The hotel is sandwiched between the freeway and an urban community (VERY NOISY). For the price, social noise and room condition was sub-par.
review.positiveRemarks: Parking was convenient.
review.negativeRemarks: Replace the coffee maker, wifi, and upgrade to hi-definition tv. The towels were stained, and there was lint and dirt streaks from housekeeping.
review.locationRemarks: My stay was business related. Close to San Francisco International Airport.

review.title: SF visit
review.reviewText: The hotel was okay, but we were in a room for the handicapped, which we did not request. There was no place to hang our clothes and the room often smelled like the sewer was backing up. On the other hand, the staff was pleasant and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was pleasant and helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Assure the sewer is draining properly.
review.locationRemarks: We took the public transportation into the city. It was about at 40 minute ride.

review.title: They don't have an airport shuttle
review.reviewText:
Hard to find, not that close to the airport, no shuttle as advertised - although they did lay on a taxi.

Fine by taxi, but driving to it is a nightmare. South Airport Boulevard takes two right angled turns at traffic lights, crosses the freeway and goes through a tunnel in the 5 blocks from the freeway junction to the hotel - then you have to make an illegal Uturn to get to it (or drive about 2 miles around the back street one way system)

review.title: bed was uncomfortable, people make too much noice.
review.reviewText: I didn't program the alarm. the clock alarm was on twice 4am and 6:30 am. mattress was hard.
review.positiveRemarks: the tv only
review.negativeRemarks: change mattress more soft or comfortable
review.locationRemarks: was closed to downtown

review.title: good location, but maid service lacked
review.reviewText: The room was very nice, but the maid service has deteriorated. Had to ask a number of times to get towels. But the front desk guy was very good and helpful, especially for my 89 year old mother who wanted oatmeal without sugar in it.

review.title: Very helpful staff
review.reviewText:
The afternoon clerk was exceptionally helpful in arranging our shuttle to and from the airport. Likewise we noticed at 2:30 AM that we needed more time to go through security, and the night clerk was also helpful in contacting the shuttle and moving up our times so we would make our flight.

Both of the staff could not be more pleasant. Would not hesitate to stay there anytime.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff, and cleanliness
review.negativeRemarks: Have more restaurants in the area to eat
review.locationRemarks: Lack adequate restaurants near the hotel. Your address on the confirmation you send us had the incorrect address. You should correct it.

review.title: Great hotel for family
review.reviewText:
VERY COMFORTABLE ROOMS, PRICE - COMFORT VERY GOOD,
EXCELLENT LOCATION AND VERY ACCESSIBLE. I RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL

review.title: Good location but room is not good
review.reviewText: This hotel is near the airport. Location is ok. Wifi is suck and room is smoky. Want to change the room but not possible.
review.positiveRemarks: No
review.negativeRemarks: Room
review.locationRemarks: SFO

review.title: Not coming back!!!!
review.reviewText:
I had the misconception to believe that Ramada hotels were in the same level of class as Holiday Inn and Best Western. When I entered my room, the beds and carpet looked clean. I'm not a neat freak by any means, but when I lifted the blankets, there was a blood spot and fluids from different extracurricular activities on the inside of the blanket. When checking the bathroom, the towel rack was rusty.

The staff was pleasant and they tried to fix the problems.

This hotel does not have much to offer other then a room to sleep in. There is no gym, internet is really slow with bad wireless reception, and the breakfast was mediocre at best.
I don't know the area of South San Francisco well, but I did not feel safe where the hotel was located at as there were many transients aggressively panhandling pedestrians. Due to this, I could not run outside and had to travel Daly City to use a gym.

Overall, I cannot recommend this hotel. I would spend more money to go to a Best Western.
review.positiveRemarks: Courteous staff
review.negativeRemarks: Dirty blankets/sheets, rusty towel rack, no gym
review.locationRemarks: I did not witness any serious crimes, but I did not feel safe

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText: Clean with basic needs. Staff was very helpful. Location is good and there is no resurents in or attached to the hotel.

review.title: Compassionate customer service
review.reviewText: We stayed at this hotel on an emergency basis after our family member died suddenly. We are grateful to Maria, the hotel reservationist, who contacted corporate headquarters to assist us with cancellation fees, and put us in a quiet room where we would not be disturbed. We would like to stay at this hotel again when we return to San Francisco. It is clean, comfortable, convenient and affordable.
review.positiveRemarks: Customer service.
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently located near the SFO airport and good restaurants within 5 minutes' drive.

review.title: Yikes. Only if price is your sole criteria.
review.reviewText: Window barely closed, amenities were difficult to understand, "airport shuttle" ended up being "Airport shuffle" - I had to take a taxi and pay for it. The toilet ran, the carafe in the coffee maker didn't fit and overflowed, the sheets were scratchy, the vending machine was out of water and the breakfast was underwhelming. Other than that, I guess it was fine.

review.title: Visit
review.reviewText: The location of the hotel its ok, but in general the condition of the hotel in general its not good, the furniture is a little old and not well treated, one day a group had a party in the parking lot, for me that shouldnt be pemited, they where grilling and drinking alcohol.

review.title: Very affordable accomodattion
review.reviewText: excellent staffs, very friendly and accomodating. From the day we arrived until the day we left no complain! Room is very clean and parking is free. Very accessible. Security camera on premises. I will definitely recommend this hotel to my colleagues.

review.title: AC condition!
review.reviewText:
The AC condition was not good at all. The last night of our stay it was very cold.
it appeared that the the AC didn't work at all.but other than that everything else was good or accepteble.
review.positiveRemarks: size of the room and the beds/ t
review.negativeRemarks: AC condition
review.locationRemarks: it was good.also the distance from SFO was good

review.title: Where is the shuttle ?
review.reviewText:
The hotel is near the airport and offers a shuttle service to and from the airport , there is no shuttle service
Once we called expedia , who in turn called the hotel , we were offered a taxi that arrived about half an hour after the call was placed .

Even though the cab was paid for by the hotel the simple truth is that offering a shutlle service that does not exist is not fair - ThIs hotel should not be allowed to anounce this service on your site .
review.positiveRemarks: none really
review.negativeRemarks: stress at the airport trying to find the shuttle service offered Expedia helped me by calling the hotel , who then sent a cab .
review.locationRemarks: Location is fine

review.title: Last minute stay
review.reviewText: The bed was uncomfortable. Parking was okay. Staff was courteous.

review.title: Our room wasn't great but maybe yours will be
review.reviewText: The hotel wasn't dirty or anything but our frig didn't work and our toilet worked but not correctly. For the price I would have liked something a little nicer, we just ended up here because everything else was sold out for fleet week. One of the shifts had great staff the other shift wasn't as sociable. Free parking was great, about a twenty minute drive downtown. Overall it was okay if you're just looking for a bed, I had to spend a little more time in the room so it was kind of frustrating. Oh and the breakfast doesn't stay out until ten like they say it does so if you want breakfast be down there before 9:30. Maybe the other rooms aren't as bad, but we had two frustrating things broken. Worth a try.
review.positiveRemarks: Free parking
review.negativeRemarks: Our fridge didn't work at all and our toilet didn't work right
review.locationRemarks: About 20-30 from downtown/fisherman's wharf, super noisy in the mornings

review.title: Ramada: comfy beds close to airport
review.reviewText: Ramada far exceeded our expectations! San Francisco is an expensive town, & we only needed lodging near the airport, so I didn't want to spend a lot of money for a 12 hr stay. The hotel was clean, comfy beds, quiet, quick front desk, close to the airport. I wish I would've booked them for our outbound trip, but I wasn't sure if it'd be adequate - now I find, they are booked up & everything else is either cheap & crummy, or waaay too expensive for 12 hrs before the flight home! I highly recommend this hotel as a good base before & after your trip to CA - wine country & Redwoods & PCH - which is why we flew into SFO.
review.positiveRemarks: Comfy beds
review.locationRemarks: Easy airport access

review.title: COMMENTS
review.reviewText:
Hi
I am really disgusted with this hotel.
Horrfiyng
review.positiveRemarks: I can not find
review.negativeRemarks: all
review.locationRemarks: Terrible

review.title: Awesome staff very accomidating!
review.reviewText: Very friendly staff accomidated my stay i Would reccomend staying at this hotel. Not in downtown so no traffic.
review.positiveRemarks: I loved the friendly staff and breakfast.

review.title: Good hotel
review.reviewText: It was a little loud just because it was on the busy street but overall it was good. The manager that was working the front desk was really nice. The hotel was clean.
review.locationRemarks: Not a bad drive to downtown to the piers

review.title: No snacks!
review.reviewText: The staff was helpful. We asked for a quiet room in the rear and it was not a problem. It had free parking which was very good. However, the only restaurant were not in walking distance. Pizza could be delivered, of wanted. The lighting system took some getting use to and there was not TV channel guide which would have been helpful. They did not even have vending machines with snacks! Only sodas. Disappointing. But, if a bed is all you want it was good. Had breakfast, but I did not eat.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean room
review.negativeRemarks: No vending machine with snacks
review.locationRemarks: close to the SFO airport, but nothing else.

review.title: Good for a family
review.reviewText: The staff was courteous and helpful. The rooms were clean and comfortable, although the toilet was hard to flush and noisy. The only downside of our experience was the continental breakfast in the lobby. The area was very small and there was only seating for 8 people, and we had 4 in our party and some of us had to stand to eat.

review.title: SameOldThing
review.reviewText:
Hot water setting for shower s/b 5 to 10 degrees higher.

And of course .... as with ALL wood-structured buildings --- there is NOT ENOUGH SOUND-PROOFING BETWEEN THE WALLS AND THE FLOORS!!!!

The people placed in the room above us (# 407) sounded like they were having a BOWLING TOURNAMENT in their room!!!!

As it turns out, it was only their 3 floor-bashing children who were causing all the racket.

This is the NUMBER ONE PROBLEM IN SO MANY MOTELS -- NOT ENOUGH SOUND-PROOFING!!!!!
review.positiveRemarks: Price
review.negativeRemarks: NOT ENOUGH SOUND-PROOFING!!!!
review.locationRemarks: Convenient.

review.title: Friendly in Frisco
review.reviewText: everyone was courteous and helpful, specially with how to get downtown Frisco the easiest and cheapest way. Great experience.
review.positiveRemarks: Relaxing
review.locationRemarks: Pick up from airport was good

review.title: affordable, boring area, great for students.
review.reviewText:
I had called the 800-number to ask about the check-in time, and they told me 10am. When I got to the hotel, the receptionist said it was 12pm. Normally I wouldn't care but we had been driving for almost 7 hours and I wanted a pace to lay down! The man was refusing to let us have a room early at first, but eventually gave in. Other than that incident, the only thing id have to complain about is the fact that the room service people insisted on coming
in every morning, even when I left the "do not disturb" sign up. The room was clean, all the employees were very nice. Good times.
Also, the bus stop was a block away that took us right into the Chinatown area. The hotel area is lame and far from everything so prepare to do some traveling
review.positiveRemarks: Clean, nice people, inexpensive
review.negativeRemarks: Boring area, a bit far from main spots in san fran.
review.locationRemarks: Boring, slightly sketchy but I wasn't worried.

review.title: Do not stay in this hotel
review.reviewText: I can not recommend this hotel at all. The "shuttle-service" means that you have to call the hotel and have them give you a special number for a taxi company that will then pick you up. In my case, it took them about an hour to do so and I had to call them three times before the driver finally showed up at the right spot. Note that there is also another Ramada Limited in SF that offers a regular shuttle-service from the airport. This apearently leads to a lot of confusion. My room smelled somewhat funky, the toilet was running and when I picked up the hotel guide, it was soaked in some kind of fluid (I hope it was just water...). The friendliness of the staff was highly variable: While one guy was very nice and super-helpful, the other guy was simply rude and appeared to be annoyed by my presence. He also left the counter for about 20 min. one morning and there is no bell or call button on the desk... The breakfast is very basic but okay. Since the breakfast room is way too small, most guests end up eating in their rooms. The hotel is also far away from the typical SF attractions (Golden Gate Bridge, Fisherman's dwarf). In sum; If you're only staying for a single night and want to be close to the airport, then this hotel might be acceptable for you. Otherwise, do not stay in this hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: shuttle-service poorly organized; rooms lack cleanliness; some staff very unfriendly; inconvenient location
review.locationRemarks: Far away from any attractions or shopping facilities

review.title: C+ hotel
review.reviewText: Clean, quiet, an average hotel period, nothing terrible nothing extraordinary
review.negativeRemarks: pressure of shower head water sucked

review.title: Hotel Concerns.
review.reviewText: The hotel was ok and pleasing to some degree. However, for the price I paid, it should've had a higher quality of furniture and such. I've been in hotels that were less than $100 a night stay and were of better quality. Although not bad, I felt that service overall was below it's 2 1/2 star standard. Also, I would like to note that while in my room, the maid entered with a key without knocking and had a little boy with her, who walked in looked at me and turned around and walked out. After the boy left, I saw hand reach in with a couple of extra towels and placed them on my luggage. One done, the hands dissappeared and the door shut. I was sort of startled this because I believe that they are suppose to know before entering. And, what if I was not dressed....what would that little boy be looking at as he entered. Because I was in a bit of a hurry to leave for an appointment, I never mentioned it to the staff on duty.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was courteous, the amenities in the room were fine. I was a bit confused about the operation of the TV, however.
review.negativeRemarks: The quality of the furniture in the room seemed to be of less standard for a hotel of this reputation and the TV was of a cheaper quality.
review.locationRemarks: The Ramada Express is located at 721 Airport Blvd, South San Francisco. I know it is convenient for travelers who need to catch a plane.

review.title: We felt welcomed
review.reviewText: When we arrived in the lobby we were greeted by GM Victor Parbhoo and he was very friendly and very funny. We felt welcomed right from the start. He made sure we were comfortable our entire visit and my husband and I really apprciated the attention that we were given. Our only complaint is that our furniture and appliance were extremely outdated but we made it work. The linen could have been more tidy as well.
review.positiveRemarks: The king size bed
review.negativeRemarks: The slow elevator and outdated furniture & appliances
review.locationRemarks: The location was perfect for us

review.title: Hotel comments
review.reviewText: The worsiest thing is.. Ramada shuttel bus brougt us to a wrong hotel.. we got a Taxi.. insted .. but in other case the shuttel cab back to the airport is excellent.. thank you
review.locationRemarks: interesting place

review.title: it is an ok place for stay near airport
review.reviewText: the hotel is ok, not as good as normal Ramada hotel, but ok for stay.

review.title: Peaceful and quiet stay
review.reviewText: Beddings are clean and smell good. Room is a bit far from elevator since I have an elderly with me. Place was unusually quiet so had a good night's sleep.
review.positiveRemarks: Ample parking, convenient location
review.negativeRemarks: Elevator seems a bit old

review.title: A pleasant surprise.
review.reviewText: After staying in a horrible Ramada in the city, this Ramada was a pleasant surprise. Close access to airport as we were leaving the next morning. Nice room. It wasn't fancy, but was perfectly nice.
review.positiveRemarks: Good deal on line for a business class room. Large space.
review.negativeRemarks: Toilet wouldn't flush properly.
review.locationRemarks: Good access to airport.

review.title: RAMADA LTD. GREAT FOR THE MONEY!
review.reviewText:
I was just looking for a motel close to the airport as I had an early flight the following day.
My room was a fair bit larger than many I had used during my trip.
It was perfectly clean and comfortable and everything worked!
Beds were very comfortable.
If I was to be a bit picky the window cleaning was overdue but that is the only adverse comment I could make.
Breakfast is not lavish but perfectly adequate.
It is very convenient for the airport.
There are also plenty nice restaurants within a few minutes of the hotel.
Overall I was well pleased with the room and the service I received and would use this place again if in the area.
I would have no hesitation in recommending it to other travellers.
review.positiveRemarks: PLENTY FREE PARKING BUT AIRPORT SHUTTLE ALSO .AVAILABLE. A FREE GUEST COMPUTER WAS AVAILABLE AND THIS WAS A GREAT CONVENIENCE.
review.negativeRemarks: EVERYTHING WAS FINE
review.locationRemarks: GREAT FOR THE AIRPORT AND CLOSE TO SEVERAL NICE RESTAURANTS.

review.title: March, 31 through April 1
review.reviewText: The people were very nice & the hotel was very nice as well.
review.positiveRemarks: The breakfast.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed was a bit hard.
review.locationRemarks: It was good.
review.userLocation: Van Nuys, Los Angeles, CA, USA

review.title: Helpful and kind
review.reviewText: Victor was very helpful and kind I will be staying here my trip to the Bay Area
review.positiveRemarks: This was very close close to where I needed to be.
review.negativeRemarks: The fact that I couldnt stay here longer
review.locationRemarks: The location of the hotel was unusual but the staff and the appearance of the Hotel made up for it.

review.title: A decent airport hotel... Worth the money!!
review.reviewText: There should be a message regarding the airport shuttle... You need to call a number for a cab and the hotel will pay for it... The check-in staff was super nice, and she told me everything I needed to be around and even going to downtown... The hotel was close to a bus station, which can take you to a BART station to downtown in case you have a longer layover...
review.positiveRemarks: Free airport cab
review.negativeRemarks: The bed is a little bit torn and beat up
review.locationRemarks: 10 minutes away from airport, walking distance to a bus station to get to a BART station

review.title: Disappointed in south Sf
review.reviewText: this hotel was recommended by Expedia due to needing two separate rooms with different bed needs. It was close to Candlestick park and eating facilities. Our room was cold and could not adjust the digital thermostat to warm it up and front desk lady not interested in assisting. The bedspread worn with at least one hole in it. I guess you get what you pay for.
review.positiveRemarks: close to ball park
review.negativeRemarks: lack of helpful front desk staff
review.locationRemarks: Close to ball park

review.title: stay away
review.reviewText: people fighting in the room next door and hallway. We want to check out asap.

review.title: Nice enough
review.reviewText: Close to Grand Av, that is a nice street. Room was big enough, even with 4 persons. Breakfast was good enough, but right at the main (sliding) doors. So in winter is pretty cold!

review.title: awful hotel
review.reviewText: bad service ... waited 2 hours for free shuttle to come and it never came ... had to take a taxi!

review.title: Great Experience
review.reviewText: I was satisfied with the location and rooms. I had two cons I did not like about Ramada and they are the length of breakfast time which was very short and the comfort of the beds.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Elevator was down, and I had previously read that it had been down for over a week by another guest!!! Place was clean and the attendants were nice so I can not complain there. Good location as it is only 5 to 8 minutes to Downtown SF. People in the unit above me and to the side of me were very loud as all night I heard there footsteps. Elevator down on Thanksgiving weekend and not fixed on Friday or Saturday really sucked!!!!
review.locationRemarks: South San Francisco because it it cheaper and away from the traffic. You don't have to pay extra for parking.

review.title: i would definetly go again
review.reviewText: the only problem was the elevator was out of service and we were on 4 th floor i also had 3 boys so that was my only issue other then that room was huge clean nice very homey staff was ok the girl there very nice the others ... not so kid friendly not far from candlestick..were definetly going back next visit

review.title: Sad old worn out hotel
review.reviewText: after checking in we were told the elevator did not work. Turns out it was broken for over a week at that time.While the room appeared clean it was worn out with old cracked lamp shades, not a cold refridgerator,very very old microwave,just made you feel ichy to be in the old sad worn out surroundings. Would not stay again, and would advise no one to book there.

review.title: Friendly Staff
review.reviewText: Staff were all very helpful with my needs. Entrance and exit were not the most convenient but was easily remedied by driving around a few minutes.

review.title: Cross it off your list
review.reviewText: This room was OK in some respects, but there were many evidences that corners are being cut in the upkeep, which makes one wonder how thoroughly other aspects of cleanliness and sanitation are being observed. The best example I can offer is that the chair in the room had stains all over it. I can only imagine from what. How the cleaning crew decides to leave such a disgusting mess in a room for the next guest is beyond me. They would have done better to set up a folding chair or lawn chair in the room, or better yet, no chair at all and claim that a replacement was on the way. Poor judgment and perhaps an indication that they have just stopped caring about half-way decent hospitality.

review.title: You paid what you get
review.reviewText:
shuttle service by the contracted taxi company is horrible.
location is too far from anything, unless you have a rental car, then it's very difficult to get around.
Staff not very friendly.

review.title: Never again.
review.reviewText: Poorly maintained rooms. Mold on torn shower curtain and wall cracks in the bathroom. Bed covers threadbare in places. Complementary breakfast of generic toasted oats cereal, toast, waffles and watered down orange juice worth skipping.

review.title: Only lodging spot whenever here again.
review.reviewText: Best feature "Pool size Jacuzzi in the room" Walking distance to authentic Tia, Mexican, Italian and American restaurants. Close to Airport, Downtown San Francisco, Tan Foran shopping Mall on El Camino street. Absolutely Best spot for the money. Safe, friendly and comfortable.

review.title: We will visit again
review.reviewText: We had an overall satisfaction on our 5 days stay in Ramada. The front desk persons were very helpful..they arranged for airport shuttle couple of times in short notice.

review.title: Unexpected
review.reviewText:
I spent one night in this hotel upon returning from an overseas trip. When we pulled up to the hotel both my friend and I were unimpressed. In fact, I considered trying to rebook elsewhere, but with jet-lag and weariness, didn't bother. It is small. It took a few minutes to get someone to the front desk to check me in.

I was pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness of the room. Matter of fact, once in the room, it would be difficult to tell this hotel apart from other more expensive hotels in the area.

So if you want a cheap place to sleep for a night, I may recommend it. But not for a vacation or family stay.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: The hotel itself was rather shabby. The bedspreads were torn & had holes. The light above the sink did not work. We reported it and were told it would be fixed but when we returned 5 hours later is was still out. All parking places were taken so we had to park in an underground garage and navigate up stairs that were unlit and full of trash. We had a hard time sleeping due to the traffic noise from the busy street below.

review.title: SF's top 5 option
review.reviewText: It was a convenient place to stay as it was just a quick drive from Pier 39 where we spent most of the day. Convenient places to eat around the hotel at night, and great reception.

review.title: Not impressed at all
review.reviewText:
I was completely dissapointed with this hotel. I used to stay in Ramada network in Europe, so I was suprised with a number of broken or mulfuction items in my room (AC, sink, WC, curtains). My breakfast was awful.
Therefore the personal was polite but not helpful at all.

review.title: Disappointed in a Ramada. Basic value at best!
review.reviewText: Mildew in bathroom. Hair in the corners. Dirty, used sheets on one of our beds. Need I say more?!?

review.title: the free shuttle cost me $17
review.reviewText: We picked this hotel because it had a free shuttle to and from the airport. We waited for 2 hours and it never came. Then we found out the free shuttle was a cab that they call for and pay for.After the ordeal to finally get there, we were treated rudely and I had to pay my own way back to the airport because our flights were 4 hours apart. Before coming we were told that was O.K. Never again!

review.title: Nice Holtel and Great Price
review.reviewText: We stayed three nights and found the room to be comfortable, clean, and a great deal. Finding the Hotel was a little tricky but doable. The breakfast left a little to be desired, not bad but could include more fruits, etc. Staff friendly and helpful. Room was clean and comfortable. Easy access to the freeway 101 to get into San Fran. Free parking was a big issue for us. I will drive the 10 minutes to save $40 for parking.

review.title: Good value, but it could be better
review.reviewText: 20 min from SFO downtown, 5 min to airport

review.title: No frills rest your head hotel.
review.reviewText: Nothing special. No laundry on site was kinda a downer but I knew that going into it. For the money it was fine.

review.title: Satisfied
review.reviewText: Satisfied with my stay. Did not take advantage of breakfast service, instead I patronized the I-Hop near by.

review.title: Okay, if everything else if booked
review.reviewText: The overall hotel experience was so-so. I don't plan on staying there again though. They gave us the key for early check-in (nice) only for us to go to a dirty room (not so nice.) The cleanliness was fair overall. There is only one ice machine, which had ice 1 out of 5 times we tried - Limited to no assistance from staff about it. Bed comfort was fair. Nice housekeeping staff, but they left a rag on our sink countertop one time after cleaning. Hotel could stand to invest in some updating and deep cleaning.

review.title: Great for overnight stay
review.reviewText: Inexpensive, clean and comfortable close to airport with shuttle service

review.title: Spacious
review.reviewText: Though there was only one elevator for the entire hotel, the room space made up for it. Our restroom door was somewhat squeaky, but the service to fix the noise was responded to immediately.

review.title: Sink outside of bathroom
review.reviewText: Sink of face washing is outside of bathroom. It's very convenient and comfortable for guests.

review.title: Good for the price
review.reviewText: I have stayed at this hotel several times. The rooms were clean and the airport shuttle is reliable. The bus service into down town San Francisco is only one block from the hotel. The breakfast is good with waffles. The only problem is that there are not enough tables to accommodate the guests for breakfast. Go to breakfast early before they run out of food.

review.title: Ok Hotel!
review.reviewText: Just ok, close to the airport!

review.title: Perfect airport hotel at a good price
review.reviewText: We have stayed at this hotel 2x. We use it as a convenient stop when we have a late flight into San Francisco. Although a little confusing to get to from the airport, we have found the evening/night desk clerk to be really nice. Rooms comfortable and clean, area quiet, and the price is right. I think this makes a perfect airport hotel

review.title: cheap, a little dirty
review.reviewText: We stayed here because of the price. The continental breakfast was pretty good. The hotel is located in a rather scary part of town. The carpets in the hallway were gross. I will spend more and stay downtown next time.

review.title: Great for Cheap Stay!
review.reviewText: While this is not an upscale hotel for SanFransico, it was extremely clean and the staff very helpful. I was worried at first because of its airport location, but after staying four nights, would definitely do it again. It's only 10 miles to downtown SF and the money we saved was well worth the 20 minute drive in to town each day. Very nice staff.

review.title: Higly rated
review.reviewText: This hotel was a pleasure to stay at, clean, roomie, very nice rooms, the grounds were immaculate! Higly recommended

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: We were expecting much better from a Ramada. The carpets appeared very dirty throughout the hotel. The breakfast was lacking in selection and not maintained well. While the room was a nice size, there wasn't sufficient hot water to get a good shower. We left the heat on low so the room would be warm when we returned. But it had been turned off so the room was very cold when we returned. My husband was there for a medical procedure, so this was a distinct hardship. We won't return to this hotel.

review.title: Nice motel but too noisy
review.reviewText: The motel was very clean with good service and a nice room. Shuttle service was great to the airport. Only problem was that it is right next to the freeway and it was very difficult to sleep with road noise.

review.title: Breakfast
review.reviewText: There could be more variety for breakfast

review.title: Overall, this is a good hotel to stay
review.reviewText: I stayed at that hotel for 2 nights. It was pretty good. It was a pretty clean room too, except the bath area still had some fell off hair from a person who stayed there prior. That was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed. It is a place close to airport, and about 10 miles from the downtown SF. The price is okay. Not really cheap, neither expensive.

review.title: Never again
review.reviewText: The room that was given, the heater did not work. After a long disagrement with hotel staff, was given another room. That heater did not work either,and the bathroom smelled like raw sewage. Was told there were no other rooms left. They were more worried that we might have messed up the room we were in for 5 min, the our heating problem and comfort. never again.

review.title: farther from airport then i thought
review.reviewText: The hotel was farther from the airport than i thought. it was very isolated feeling.

review.title: nothing great... satisfactory at best
review.reviewText: hotel is kinda worn down a bit... not bad for the price and close to the airport... i've stayed in worse... it's ok... i recommend other people to stay there because of the price, but personally i won't. wifi signal is also weak for anyone with a laptop.

review.title: Not Impressed
review.reviewText: Hotel room kinda smelled. Air condition did not work that well. Did not supply lotion, shampoo or conditioner. But did have FREE internet, which is a big plus for me.

review.title: Nice place, not a smile from front desk
review.reviewText: Stayed three nights, rented three rooms, they were nice and for location and price good deal. Unfortunately front desk personel need lots of training in customer service,I used to work front desk myself, no smiles and they actually called my room to see if maid was there, said no and she asked to look out my door, I was relaxing watching T.V.

review.title: Would Stay Again
review.reviewText: This hotel was easy to find and in a great location. Several restaraunts within walking distance.
Satisfatory in general, except for a female employee's attitudes at the counter did not feel too nice.

review.title: Couldn't get the airport shuttle to pick us up for 1 hour
review.reviewText: We got in late (midnight) and were told that the airport shuttle ran until 12:45am. Once we finally got the shuttle to pick us up it was 1:00am and the shuttle driver gave us so much attitude. The front desk was very helpful and the breakfast wasn't bad, but the shuttle catastrophe got our trip off to a horrible start.

review.title: Ramada
review.reviewText: The carpets were dirty, there was a brown sticky substance splattered on the wall, enough towels were not provided even after requested, and there were a lot of little flying insects in the room. It was a very uncomfortable stay, unfortunately.

review.title: Convenient hotel for SF sightseeing
review.reviewText: This hotel is very close to San Francisco Internatinal airport. Whether you are travelling by rental car or shuttle, you will be checked in and relaxing in your room within just a few minutes. The staff were extremely friendly and very helpful. We had many laughs with the front desk clerks. Wake up early (6:30) for homemade waffles. Get there late and you will be battling small children for the waffle maker. There is little to do in the immediate area but a 5-minute drive south on 101 will lead to you a mall with all the shopping/food you need. There is also a local italian restaurant that will deliver great food to your room.

review.title: Decent for the price...
review.reviewText: Our recent stay here was, overall, pretty decent. The hotel is near the airport and close to a BART station for easy subway access to the city. Room condition o.k., some general wear and tear evident (i.e. small imperfections in comforter, etc). Neighborhood was so-so, but there was an area of small shops and restaurants within a couple of blocks. Staff was very courteous and helped with directions.

review.title: A well rounded hotel
review.reviewText: Ours was a group of 3 students arriving late Friday evening, but with 24-hour front desk service our late check-in was no problem. Despite the proximity to the airport, the room was incredibly quiet. Everything was very clean, well organized and complemented by a generous list of amenities (including cable television with movie channels). As college students, we were particulary jazzed by the waffle iron provided at the free continental breakfast. The somewhat later-than-average 12pm check-out is also convenient for those wishing to sleep in after a long day or late night.

review.title: Not impressed
review.reviewText: It's not bad for the price the hotel charges.

review.title: pretty good
review.reviewText: good for early flight

review.title: Stay for early flight
review.reviewText: We stayed one night so we could make an early morning flight. They offer shuttle service starting at 4:30 a.m. Very nice staff. Very accommodating.

review.title: Great staff
review.reviewText: This is a small hotel - but it offers a really great staff and ample free parking. The front desk help really work hard to make sure you are comfortable and happy. There is no room service, but there is a free breakfast and most places deliver to the hotel
